document.masterDocTitle: Freshwater lampreys and fishes of Turkey; a revised and updated annotated checklist 2020

subSubSection.paragraph:
Alburnoides coskuncelebii Turan, Kaya, Aksu, Bayçelebi & Bektaş, 2019
[E]―[NE], -/Noktali inci baligi/Büyük Melen River in the Southern Black Sea basin (
Turan et al. 2019a
).

Alburnoides diclensis Turan, Bektaş, Kaya & Bayçelebi, 2016
[E]―[NE], Tigris chub/Noktali inci baligi/Eziki Stream, Tigris River Drainage (
Turan et al. 2016a
).

Alburnoides freyhofi Turan, Kaya, Bayçelebi, Bektaş & Ekmekçi, 2017
[E]―[NE], Spirlin/-/Kizilirmak drainage (
Turan et al. 2017a
).

Alburnoides kosswigi Turan, Kaya, Bayçelebi, Bektaş & Ekmekçi, 2017
[E]―[NE], Spirlin/-/ Sakarya drainage (
Turan et al. 2017a
).

Alburnoides kurui Turan, Kaya, Bayçelebi, Bektaş & Ekmekçi, 2017
[E]―[NE], Spirlin/-/Yeşilirmak drainage (
Turan et al. 2017a
).

Alburnoides turani Kaya, 2020
[E]―[NE], -/Noktali inci baligi/Filyos River, Black Sea drainages in the same region as
A. coskuncelebii
and
A. tzanevi ( Kaya, 2020 )
.

Alburnoides tzanevi Chichkoff, 1933
[N]―[DD], Western Black Sea spirlin/Noktali inci baligi/Black Sea drainages (Turan et al. 2013; 2014;
Çiçek et al . 2015
; Kaya, 2020 ).

Alburnus goekhani Özulug, Geiger & Freyhof, 2018
[E]―[NE], Bleak/Inci baligi// Kizilirmak River basin (
Özulug et al. 2018
).

Alburnus kotschyi Steindachner, 1863
[E]―[LC], Arsuz bleak/Inci baligi/Seyhan and Ceyhan river basins (
Fricke et al . 2007
;
Çiçek et al . 2015
; Freyhof et al. 2018c).

Alburnus magnificus Freyhof & Turan, 2019
[E]―[NE], Shemaya/Inci baligi/northern Orontes River ( Freyhof & Turan 2019 ). Remarks: The previous record of
Alburnus qalilus
from Turkey was identified by Freyhof and Turan (2019) as the new species
Alburnus magnificus
. Actually there were no big genetic differences between
A. magnificus
and
A. qalilus
. Therefore
A. magnificus
is probably a synonym of
A. qalilus . Alburnus qalilus
is distributed in some Syrian basins. When serial genetic analysis of populations done, it will be revealed that are closely related and only minor differences are expected.

Chondrostoma ceyhanensis Küçük, Turan, Güçlü, Mutlu & Çiftçi, 2017
[E]―[NE], Ceyhan Nase/Kababurun baligi/Seyhan and Berdan drainages (
Küçük et al. 2017
).

Chondrostoma toros Küçük, Turan, Güçlü, Mutlu & Çiftçi, 2017
[E]―[NE], Nase/Kababurun baligi/Göksu River (
Küçük et al. 2017
).

Chondrostoma turnai Güçlü, Çiftçi, Küçük, Turan & Mutlu, 2018
[E]―[NE], Nase/Kababurun baligi/Büyük Menderes River basin (
Güçlü et al. 2018
).

Petroleuciscus ninae Turan, Kalayci, Kaya, Bektas & Küçük, 2018
[E]―[NE], Chub/-/Büyük Menderes River (Turan et al. 2018).

Pseudophoxinus cilicicus Saç, Özulug, Geiger & Freyhof, 2019
[E]―[NE], Arsuz minnow/-/Arsuz, Ceyhan basin (
Saç et al. 2019
).

Pseudophoxinus iconii Küçük, Gülle & Güçlü, 2016
[E]―[NE], -/-/Cihanbeyli, Lake Tuz Basin (
Küçük et al. 2016
).

Pseudophoxinus mehmeti Ekmekçi, Atalay, Yogurtçuoglu, Turan & Küçük, 2015
[E]―[NE], -/-/Alanköy basin in southwestern Turkey (
Ekmekçi et al. 2015
).

Squalius orientalis (Nordmann, 1840)
[N]―[NE], Dace/-/Choruck River basin ( Geldiay & Balik 2007 ).

Squalius semae Turan, Kottelat & Bayçelebi, 2017
[E]―[NE], Chub/-/Karasu Stream, upper Euphrates River Basin (
Turan et al. 2017b
).
